sub_title: Child Protection and Participation National Trainer
summary:
Gilbert is a Lawyer by profession with extensive quantitative and qualitative research experience both in the academic & professional arenas. He has initiated and participated in various International legal research studies and has presented at international conferences, symposiums, and colloquiums and regularly contributes to industry publications on Minority Rights.  His major focus of interest is in International Children's Rights . 

Gilbert periodically lectures on  Juvenile Justice Systems and the development of Constitutionalism at various institutions of higher learning sharing his passion for and skill in research.  He was the focal point person on law reforms in the GRZ/UN Joint programme on Gender Based Violence from 2012-2016. 

Gilbert has led distinctive teams in developing government and non governmental systems on child protection in order to bring them in conformity with International, Regional and Domestic laws on Child Right. To name but a few, he led a team in establishing Africa's first Fast track court to deal with Gender Based Violence with a focus on child and women protection when in contact with the Law. Led and participated on various evidence based research which resulted in proposing to the Government of Zambia reforms on topics such as the "Criminalization of Early, Child and Forced Marriages", the Penal Code and Criminal Procedure Code (Sexual Offences, etc), The review of the Anti-Human Trafficking Act( unaccompanied minors and Children on the move),the Intestate Succession Act and the Children Code Bill among others, A profound contributor to the World Bank "Women Business and Law"  Survey. Member of the Child Justice Forum technical team which looks at Child Justice systems in Zambia. His professional and in depth acumen earned him various awards such as the University of the Western Cape Vice Chancellor leadership Award in 2009, the Zambia Congress of Trade Union (Most innovative award) 2013, the Best speaker in the Child Law African Trade Moot Court among others. He is equally passionate about governance and democracy  and he has participated in various governance discussions globally with the view of sharing ideas on new and trending governance landscapes. He believes that a failing governance system will always have a negative effect on Children Right's.
